# {{PROJECT_NAME}} Platform Documentation - LLM Navigation Index

> **START HERE**: For comprehensive LLM orchestration (plan files, concurrent execution, execution order, review loops), see [LLM.md](./LLM.md)

This file provides a quick navigation guide for LLMs working with the {{PROJECT_NAME}} platform documentation.

## Documentation Structure

```
docs/spec/
├── LLM.md                    # Master LLM orchestration guide (START HERE for complex tasks)
├── SPEC-WRITING-GUIDE.md     # How to write specification documents
├── README.md                 # Human-readable index
├── llms.txt                  # This file - quick navigation
├── .llm/                     # LLM coordination folder
│   ├── PROGRESS.md           # Accumulated knowledge and iteration log (READ BEFORE STARTING)
│   ├── STRATEGY.md           # Project decomposition for parallel agents
│   ├── AGENT_GUIDE.md        # Agent context (inlined into every prompt)
│   ├── SKILLS.md             # Agent skills and capabilities catalog
│   ├── plans/                # Active plan.llm files
│   ├── completed/            # Archived completed plans
│   ├── templates/            # Plan + task templates
│   ├── scripts/              # Utility + agent harness scripts
│   ├── tasks/                # Parallel agent task queue (backlog, in_progress, completed, blocked)
│   └── logs/                 # Agent execution logs
├── framework/                # Generic patterns (read first)
└── biz/                      # Business specs (features, research, decisions)
```

## For Multi-Step Tasks

1. Read `LLM.md` first
2. Read `.llm/PROGRESS.md` for prior learnings
3. Decompose into task files (default) or create a plan file (interactive)
4. Follow the execution order specified in `LLM.md`
5. Launch agents (`run-parallel.sh`) or work interactively
6. Update `PROGRESS.md` with learnings when done

## Common Task Flows

### Building Features (Default: Parallel)
1. Read `.llm/PROGRESS.md` for codebase patterns and `.llm/STRATEGY.md`
2. Decompose into 2-8 independent subtasks (75-150 turns each)
3. Edit `.llm/AGENT_GUIDE.md` — add project context, tech stack, quality gates
4. Create tasks: `cp .llm/templates/task.template.md .llm/tasks/backlog/01-task-name.md`
5. Present decomposition to user, get approval
6. Launch agents: `bash docs/spec/.llm/scripts/run-parallel.sh 3`
7. Monitor: `bash docs/spec/.llm/scripts/status.sh`

### Interactive Review / Iteration
1. Read `.llm/PROGRESS.md` for codebase patterns
2. Pick highest-priority incomplete item from plan
3. Implement the change
4. Run quality gates (build, test, lint)
5. Update PROGRESS.md with learnings
6. Commit and move to next item

## Key Conventions

| Aspect | Convention | Example |
|--------|------------|---------|
| IDs | UUIDv7 (time-ordered) | `018f6b1a-0b3c-7d4e-8f9a-1b2c3d4e5f6a` |
| Timestamps | RFC 3339, UTC | `2024-01-15T10:30:00Z` |
| Updates | JSON Patch (RFC 6902) | `[{"op": "replace", "path": "/name", "value": "new"}]` |
| Pagination | Cursor-based | `?cursor=abc&limit=50` |
| Errors | E-codes | `{"code": "E3001", "message": "..."}` |
| API Versioning | URL path | `/api/v1/...` |
